page.title: 07Mixed Farming
page.content: Bridge Farm, which is several hundred years old, and Lower Farm are a combined unit of 361 acres. A mixed farm, they employ two full time workers and a student. There are 123 milking fresians and 2 dry cows (1 newly born and the other 4 years old). They are milked at 6.30am and 3.30pm and produce around 1200 litres of milk per day. At the moment 28 are kept inside because of ringworm. There are two bulls. A new drainage system is presently being constructed in the yard. There is a small flock of 28 of the rare Shropshire breed of sheep. They are shorn very early in order to encourage quick regrowth of a second fleece. 30 acres of barley are grown and there is a cider apple orchard.
